page.title: 01Preston in 1086
page.content: At the time of Domesday in 1086 Preston consisted of 8 manors with Franc another Franc,Basinc,Macus, Tor,Gamel,Torber andTuruert as the owners. There were 10 carucates of land to be taxed and there were about 10 ploughs. There was a priest and a church. Drogo de Brevere was the Lord of Holderness he held it as a gift from William.Drogo's castle was at Skipsea,to the north of Preston. 3 of Drogo's knights had 11 villeins and 4 bordars.The whole of Preston was reckoned at about 350 acres.By the 1500's this acreage had risen to about 3000 acres.
